text: Alan Jay Heeger (born January 22, 1936) is an American physicist and academic. He won the 2000 Nobel Prize in Chemistry. He won the prize with Alan G. MacDiarmid and Hideki Shirakawa "for their discovery and development of conductive polymers". Heeger was born in Sioux City, Iowa, to a Jewish family. He grew up in Akron, Iowa. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:American physicists Category:American chemists Category:Academics from Pennsylvania Category:Scientists from Iowa Category:People from Sioux City, Iowa Category:University of California faculty
title: Alan J. Heeger
